response: narrative=Mohammed Day, a mental health facility patient, was last seen at a closet inside the dance studio located at 1 Garrison Place, Falkirk, FK1 1AA. His grandmother and Teresa Kemp were present during his last known sighting. Concerns heightened when he did not respond to calls. Fortunately, he was traced to Bruce Street, Alloa, FK10 1RX, unharmed.

narrative=Mohammed Day was last seen at a gas station on 33 Spittal Street, leaving his passport and documents behind. Jean Edwards checked the home closet, finding no clues. Family members traced him safely to Greenside Street, Alloa.

narrative=Mohammed Day was last seen by his sister at 43 Union Road, FK1 4PG, playing hide and seek. He was hiding in a closet when his sister stopped hearing him. Concerned, the family searched the area and notified the police. Later, his grandmother mentioned seeing someone resembling Mohammed near 130 Bo'ness Road, Grangemouth, FK3 9BX. Mohammed was eventually found safe at a nearby gas station on Crossgatehead Road.

narrative=Mohammed Day, a 10-year-old, disappeared from his home at 43 Union Road. He was last seen by his sister entering the small closet near the living room. His sudden absence led to concerns, especially because of his high initial risk level. Clues revealed that Mohammed might have been fascinated by a story his aunt told about adventures near Glensburgh Road, FK3 8XJ. The police traced Mohammed to Greenside Street, Alloa, FK10 1EB, where he was found safe, having sought out these stories on his own.

narrative=Mohammed Day, a 10-year-old boy, was reported missing from his home address on Union Road. His absence was noticed after his family found he had left behind his passport and important documents, a pattern that raised concerns given his status as a patient of a mental health facility. Mohammed was last seen by his uncle, Alan Day, earlier that day. His family, particularly his grandmother, were deeply worried as he had never exhibited such behavior before. After a thorough search, police traced Mohammed to 14 The Meadows, Stirling, FK9 5AE. Upon discovery, he was safe and unharmed, providing relief to his concerned family.

narrative=Mohammed Day went missing from 43 Union Road, Falkirk. Sightings were reported at a gas station on Bo'ness Road. His sister, Lynn Jones, noted erratic behavior common to mental health facility patients. Mohammed was eventually found safe in a closet at Greenside Street.
narrative=Mohammed Day left documents and was last seen at a gas station near 24 Munro Road, Stirling. His aunt reported him missing.

narrative=Mohammed Day, aged 11, was last seen at a gas station on 130 Bo'ness Road, Grangemouth, FK3 9BX. He had left home without his passport and documents, which was unusual given his organized nature. Earlier, he was with his sister and a friend, planning an adventurous day. They eventually parted ways, with Mohammed expressing he wanted to explore the area alone. Concern grew when he did not return home, and his father reported him missing. Search efforts extended to a closet in an abandoned house at 14 The Meadows, Stirling, FK9 5AE, but Mohammad had moved on. Finally, a member of the public found Mohammed safe on Glensburgh Road, noting he showed little awareness of the time that had passed.

narrative=Mohammed Day, a mental health facility patient, was reported missing from his residence at 43 Union Road, FK1 4PG. His aunt, concerned about his well-being, visited him earlier and noticed him behaving unusually. After she left, Mohammed went unnoticed for several hours until his sister discovered his absence. Earlier in the day, Mohammed was spotted at a gas station near 14 The Meadows, Stirling, FK9 5AE, where a colleague, Dominic Hicks, remembered seeing him purchasing snacks, seemingly in distress. As investigations intensified, reports came in about a boy seen near the closets in a fast food restaurant along West Bridge Street, Falkirk, FK1 5AP. After being traced by the police, Mohammed was found safe at an address in Grangemouth, albeit confused but physically unharmed.

narrative=Mohammed Day, a patient at a mental health facility, was last seen leaving 43 Union Road. His father reported he went missing after visiting a local gas station. He was later found safe in a closet at home.
